metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3123 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: libmysqld). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.42 andprior, 5.7.24 and prior and 8.0.13 and prior. Difficult to exploitvulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access viamultiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data orcomplete access to all MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score5.9 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3123` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
mysql-client - 5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
mysql-server - 5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.25-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
